bugs.title: CVE-2024-8909 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in UI [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-8909 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in UI [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-8909 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in UI

long_desc.thetext:
An inappropriate implementation flaw was found in the UI component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=341353783

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2312962

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-d273b23c67 (chromium-129.0.6668.58-1.fc40) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-d273b23c67

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-034e4b1091 (chromium-129.0.6668.58-1.el9) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-034e4b1091

FEDORA-2024-3d29b1647b (chromium-129.0.6668.58-1.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-3d29b1647b

FEDORA-2024-d273b23c67 has been pushed to the Fedora 40 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-d273b23c67`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-d273b23c67

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-034e4b1091

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2024-3d29b1647b has been pushed to the Fedora 39 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-3d29b1647b`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-3d29b1647b

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-8908 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-8908 chromium: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-8908 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Autofill in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Low)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2312959

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-8907 chromium: Insufficient data validation in Omnibox [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-8907 chromium: Insufficient data validation in Omnibox [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-8907 chromium-browser: Insufficient data validation in Omnibox

long_desc.thetext: Insufficient data validation in Omnibox in Google Chrome on Android prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to inject arbitrary scripts or HTML (XSS) via a crafted set of UI gestures. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2312958

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-8905 chromium-browser: Inappropriate implementation in V8

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 129.0.6668.58 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit stack corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:
